channel.title: Government of Nova Scotia News Releases
channel.description: Press releases from the Government of Nova Scotia. Distributed by Communications Nova Scotia.
channel.dc:creator: Communications Nova Scotia

image.title: Government of Nova Scotia News Releases

item.title: Un décès, 83 nouveaux cas de COVID-19, 46 cas résolus
item.description: COVID - 19 / Health and Wellness -- REMARQUE : La Nouvelle-Écosse commencera à signaler le nombre d'écoles où il y a une exposition possible au virus chaque jour à compter de demain, le 28 septembre. Aujourd'hui 27 septembre, la Nouvelle-Écosse annonce un décès lié à la COVID-19. Un octogénaire est décédé dans le secteur du centre.
item.dc:creator: COVID - 19 / Health and Wellness

item.title: One Death, 83 New Cases of COVID-19, 46 Recoveries
item.description: COVID - 19 / Health and Wellness -- NOTE: Nova Scotia will begin reporting the number of schools with cases of COVID-19 daily, starting tomorrow, Sept. 28 Today, Sept. 27, Nova Scotia is reporting one death related to COVID-19. A man in his 80s in Central Zone has died.
item.dc:creator: COVID - 19 / Health and Wellness

item.title: Investment Supports Efforts to Attract Newcomers and Build Nova Scotia’s Economy
item.description: Communities, Culture, Tourism and Heritage / Labour, Skills and Immigration -- A $2.5-million marketing investment will support new provincial immigration and migration targets by helping Nova Scotia attract newcomers from across Canada and around the globe.
item.dc:creator: Communities, Culture, Tourism and Heritage / Labour, Skills and Immigration

item.title: Government Invests in Road and Rink Improvements
item.description: Communities, Culture, Tourism and Heritage / Public Works -- Government is investing $33.5 million in three programs to improve roads and rinks in Nova Scotia.
item.dc:creator: Communities, Culture, Tourism and Heritage / Public Works

item.title: Premier’s Statement on Truth and Reconciliation Week
item.description: Premier's Office -- NOTE: The following is a statement from Premier Tim Houston Kwe. Teluisi (hello, my name is) Premier Tim Houston.
item.dc:creator: Premier's Office

item.title: Paramedics Recognized on Ninth Annual Medic Monday
item.description: Health and Wellness -- Today, Sept. 27, is the ninth annual Medic Monday in Nova Scotia. It is a day to celebrate the 1,200 dedicated paramedics who provide highly skilled care to Nova Scotians every day.
item.dc:creator: Health and Wellness

item.title: First Session of the 64th General Assembly Resumes Oct. 12
item.description: Speaker's Office -- The first session of the 64th General Assembly will resume at 1 p.m. on Tuesday, Oct. 12 when the Lieutenant-Governor of Nova Scotia delivers the speech from the throne.
item.dc:creator: Speaker's Office

item.title: More Support for Communities Across Nova Scotia
item.description: Municipal Affairs and Housing -- Municipalities will receive an additional $32 million from the province to help pay for crucial services for Nova Scotians.
item.dc:creator: Municipal Affairs and Housing

item.title: 34 nouveaux cas de COVID-19, 12 cas résolus
item.description: COVID - 19 / Health and Wellness -- REMARQUE : Le gouvernement de la Nouvelle-Écosse ne publie pas de communiqués sur la COVID-19 et ne fait pas la mise à jour du tableau de bord sur la COVID-19 pendant la fin de semaine. La mise à jour du lundi inclura les données de la fin de semaine. Aujourd'hui 24 septembre, la Nouvelle-Écosse signale 34 nouveaux cas de COVID-19 et 12 rétablissements.
item.dc:creator: COVID - 19 / Health and Wellness
